result.execSummary:
The defendant Herman Durrell Adams Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges, cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of an entry of a civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample and pay all associated costs.
Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or combination of both.
Mental Health Evaluation and any treatment deemed appropriate.       Successfully complete Anger Management.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: Huber for work. Court opposes electronic monitoring. Sentence to commence FORTHWITH.
Successfully complete 20 hours of community service with a non-profit organization.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count 1, with credit for zero days time served. STRAIGHT TIME.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Herman Durrell Adams in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 11 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, concurrent with count 1, with credit for zero days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction.  
          Court granted Huber privileges for work.
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Successfully complete Anger Management.
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment.
     *   No contact with Sally A.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges, cash bail to apply. 
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of
          an entry of a civil judgment.
     *   Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or
          combination of both.
     *   Successfully complete 20 hours of community
          service with a non-profit organization.
     *  Provide a DNA sample and pay all associated costs.

Court opposes electronic monitoring.
Sentence to commence FORTHWITH. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Herman Durrell Adams in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.
As to Counts 1 and 2:    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.    Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 45.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Herman Durrell Adams in court with attorney Zoey Everett for Mark Allan Dluzak.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Last adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant Herman Durrell Adams in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Herman Durrell Adams in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing, however, the defendant is not ready to enter a plea on this date.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 23. Parties are advised that as of August 1, 2015, this case is reassigned to Br. 23, Judge Grady, room 515 of the courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM031199  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-26-2015

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Herman Durrell Adams not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant's appearance waived.  Defense counsel requests an adjourned plea/sentencing date.  No objection from the state. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.

Defendant Herman Durrell Adams in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  Court amends signature bond to cash bail.  Case remains calendared for projected guilty plea on 06-26-2015 in Branch 45.

Defendant Herman Durrell Adams in court.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Case in court due to violation. Defense counsel unavailable at this time.  State makes no comments or recommendations at this time. Court orders defendant back at 1:30 pm this afternoon to address the violation with defense counsel present.

Defendant Herman Durrell Adams in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court is in trial on another matter, case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for projected guilty plea. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SALLY A-T.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Herman Durrell Adams in court with attorney Kevin B. Dunn.  Defendant Herman Durrell Adams in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
